DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Amniotic Fluid Lamellar Body Count Fetal Pulmonary Artery Doppler Indices Predicting Fetal Lung Maturity
DOC.detailed_description: Neonatal respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) remain major cause neonatal morbidity mortality . A recent epidemiologic study United States estimate 80,000 case neonatal RDS year , result 8500 deaths hospital cost excess $ 4.4 billion . A number biochemical test develop predict risk RDS assist obstetric care provider delivery timing . Amniotic fluid lamellar body count ( LBC ) important biophysical test , base measure concentration pulmonary surfactant amniotic fluid . It effectively use assess fetal lung maturity . A noninvasive test fetal lung maturity ( FLM ) would useful minimize need invasive test would acceptable woman . Fetal pulmonary artery Doppler waveform acceleration/ejection time may provide noninvasive mean determine fetal lung maturity relatively acceptable level sensitivity , specificity , predictive value . The investigator study 200 woman singleton pregnancy present prelabor preterm rupture membrane undergo cesarean section ( CS ) . Amniotic fluid lamellar body count ( LBC ) fetal pulmonary artery Doppler do woman . LBC fetal pulmonary artery Doppler correlate fetal outcome . Quantitative data statistically represent term mean ± standard deviation ( ± SD ) categorical data represent frequency percentage . Comparison quantitative data do use Mann Whitney U test independent sample categorical data compare use Chi square test Fisher exact test appropriate . A probability value ( p value ) less 0.05 consider significant .
